title-group.article-title: About time: Problems of narrative in the Battle Mural at Cacaxtla

p.mixed-citation: López de Molina and Molina Feal 1986:22-23, 35, 41
Michel Graulich read this place name in Nahuatl as Xiuhtian or "Near Turquoise," with the heart glyph (Nahuatl yollotl)
: "k'uhul ajaw of X placé' (holy lord of X place), rather than references to a place alone (Mathews 1991 ).
Hirth's suggestion that they represent an expression for tribute (1989:73-75)
Cecelia Klein discusses accounts ofTlatelolcan women expressing breast milk in defense of their city (1994:218-220).
Cacaxtla may evoke these rites, inverting this moment of triumph into a scene of humiliation (2009:79-86).
